INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10169
Section (1) A facility shall have and follow written policy and procedure which
Description stipulates that residents shall not be subject to any of the following:
(a) corporal or cruel punishment
(b) humiliation
(c) mental abuse
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In 2019, staff member broke a foster child's arm during a restraint. The
child was moved out of the unit and staff was placed on a leave of
absence. As of today, staff is employed at the facility and there are
concerns that staff will harm another juvenile.
Investigation It is to be noted that the actual perpetrator on the allegations was
inaccurately noted in the allegations. It was confirmed through
Complainant 1 who the actual alleged perpetrator should be in the
allegations.
2

On 1/5/23, I spoke to Complainant 1 via telephone. Complainant 1
reported that he did not know of anyone that was being hurt by Staff 1
currently. Complainant 1 was just concerned Staff 1 may harm
someone due to being involved in an investigation in 2019.
I interviewed Administrator 1 on 1/5/23 via telephone and face to face
on 1/12/23. Administrator 1 reported that Staff 1 is on third shift and
does not interact with the youth as he once did. Administrator 1 did
report there have been issues with Staff 1 and they are documented in
his disciplinary files. Administrator 1 reported that there have been no
complaints that Staff 1 has hurt children or is currently harming
children, nor any grievances.
I reviewed DCWL Investigation 2019C0420020 and the Corrective
Action Plan. Pertaining to Staff 1, the agency was found in non-
compliance of R. 400.4112, R 400.4159, and R 400.4158 2(a) (c). Staff
1 pulled a youth from the bench instead of using proper de-escalation
techniques. Staff 1 was placed on the CPS abuse/neglect registry. Due
to this placement, he was suspended on March 28, 2019, while
completing an appeal for the registry. If Staff 1 is removed from the
registry, and the facility would like to maintain Staff 1 as an employee
then Staff 1 would have to complete "restraint procedures for De-
escalation, escort, and restraint training with an emphasis on how to
move residents when they are refusing to let go of a stationary object."
I reviewed CPS clearances for Staff 1 since 2019 to present date. Staff
1 is not on the CPS registry.
I reviewed Staff 1's training and all training was completed for the
corrective action plan as well as up to date.
I reviewed Staff 1's overall disciplinary record.
2/19/19: 30-day+ Suspension due to investigation 2019C0420020
9/20/20: 14-day suspension for using a cell phone while managing the
group.
11/17/20: 30-day suspension not following Covid precautions.
6/6/22: Settlement agreement for excessive horseplay.
8/9/22: Reviewed, two youth able to be together against behavior
management plan.
9/15/22: Ongoing review for being disruptive in school classroom.
10/19/22: Notice given to move to 3rd shift in accordance with union
contract.
I reviewed Staff 1's Performance Evaluation dated 9/1/22. Staff will
receive a 6-month work performance on 6/1/23 instead of a yearly one
4

to determine performance. The following goals were noted on his
evaluation:
1) Keep a clean record on write ups until 6/1/23
2) Take initiative to work with new staff on the wing
3) Improvement in management of group
4) Work on fundamental skill on computer
I interviewed Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C face to face at the facility
on 1/12/23. All three-youth reported they knew Staff 1 and have never
seen or heard anyone state they have been harmed by Staff 1. All
three-youth reported they feel safe with Staff 1.
Analysis There is no evidence to conclude that Staff 1 is actively harming youth
in the facility. The agency has trained Staff 1 and disciplined him
according to their policies and have up to date evaluations in place
monitoring his staffing ability. They have moved him to a position where
the agency feels Staff 1 is better suited and has not been reprimanded
since that time.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
